bill_title: allow certain students to be excused from participating in certain assessments, examinations, and tests.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow certain students to be excused from participating in certain assessments, examinations, and tests. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-3 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Notwithstanding the provisions of any other law or administrative rule, a parent or guardian of a student enrolled in a public school may refuse to allow the student to participate in any assessment, examination, or test that is not administered solely for the use of an individual classroom teacher. The assessments, examinations, and tests from which a student may be excused pursuant to this section include the following: (1) Any statewide assessments required pursuant to § 13-3-55; (2) Any benchmark examination; (3) Any pre-assessment or post-assessment connected to student learning objectives or any assessment mandated by the Governor's office; (4) Any milestone testing; (5) Any progress-monitoring or response-to-intervention assessment; (6) Any online assessment system or adaptive testing done in a computer laboratory; (7) Any exam used to formulate an evaluation or score for a student's teacher or school; or (8) Any survey, electronic or paper, that is not designed by the student's teacher for use in classroom instruction.
